message:
ATTENTION!

If you play video games — please note that this tool works on AutoHotkey, which may be prohibited in games, including in background mode, due to players using .ahk scripts to gain unfair advantage over other players.

To avoid problems with game anti-cheats, it is recommended to disable all AutoHotkey processes before playing.

The risk is highest in the following games: Marvel Rivals, Apex Legends, games with BattlEye anti-cheat.

Close this window to obtain them.

remapping.description:
When remapping is enabled, all standard keyboard keys will be reassigned according to the selected layout except QWERTY/QWERTY. This setting may interfere with application bindings, such as games.

Remapping will be relevant for custom layouts.

When possible, it is recommended to use a similar system layout instead of remapping.

warnings.incompatible_with_telex: Cannot activate alternative mode “{}” while {@default:TELEX}-like mode “{}” is active.

description:
Modifier keys such as Shift, Alt, Win, etc. have been abbreviated for compactness in the interface:

{var:LeftAlt}, {var:RightAlt} — left and right Alt.
{var:LeftShift}, {var:RightShift} — left and right Shift.
{var:LeftControl}, {var:RightControl} — left and right Ctrl.
{var:Window} — Win key.
{var:CapsLock} — CapsLock in active state.

Interface:
{var:RightControl} F9 — open settings window
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} Home — main panel.

Bindings and input:
{var:RightControl} F10 — toggle all bindings state (on/off).
{var:RightAlt} F1 — toggle “Fast Keys” state (on/off, saved to settings file).
{var:RightAlt}{var:RightShift} F1 — toggle input mode between {@default:unicode}/HTML codes/LaTeX commands.
{var:RightAlt} F2 — toggle {@default:TELEX} mode for Vietnamese.
{var:RightAlt}{var:RightShift} F2 — toggle {@default:TELEX} mode for Pinyin.

Other:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} PgUp — open {@default:unicode} web resource for selected symbol.

Right-click on list item — context menu.
Double left-click on list item — open {@default:unicode} web resource for symbol.

Left-click on {@default:unicode} block at bottom of symbol preview — open corresponding web page.
Double left-click with {var:LeftShift} held on list item — add or remove symbol from favorites list.
Double left-click with {var:LeftControl} held on list item — copy symbol.

Right-click — context menu.
Left-click — open main panel.
Left-click with {var:LeftControl} held — open settings window.
Left-click with {var:LeftAlt} held — open custom recipes window.
Left-click with {var:LeftShift} held — open Alternative Input selector.
Left-click with {var:LeftControl}{var:LeftShift} held — open Glyph Variations selector.

For Russian language, the names of various symbols of one or another alphabet sometimes turn out to be the same, which is why extended Cyrillic letters had to be introduced to prevent duplication of symbol names and tags within the same alphabet:
 • “Ҫ” — equivalent of Latin digraph “th” or sound [θ].
 • “Ҙ” — equivalent of Latin digraph “dh” or sound [ð].
 • “Ҳ” — equivalent of Latin digraph “kh” or sound [ħ].
 • “Ғ” — equivalent of Latin digraph “gh” or sound [ɣ].
 • “Ў” — equivalent of sound [w].
 • “Қ” — equivalent of sound [q].
 • “Ԯ” — equivalent of sound [ɬ].

Combination: {var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} F
Most library symbols have their own tags, which are variants of the symbol name that can be used for insertion through search.
Enter the tag completely or partially (or entry name) to insert the corresponding symbol. You can enter multiple queries at once by separating them with commas. Examples:
 • “hellenic capital letter lambda”, “hel lam”, “hel_c_let_l_lambda” → “Λ”
 • “дез ди, !дез ди”, “lamb, !lamb” → “𐐔𐐼”, “Λλ”.
 • “reference_mark” → “※”.

Notes:
 • The shorter the query — the less accurate it is.
 • The “!” sign at the beginning of the query tells the search to use case sensitivity.
 • Simple regular expressions are supported, for example:
    ‣ “fut.*?\s+\S+al” → “ᚺ” (Hagalaz rune)
    ‣ “az$” → “ᛞ” (Mannaz rune)
    ‣ “^фра” → “₣” (Franc).

When searching, you can specify the desired glyph variation by adding “::<VARIATION>” to the end of the query, for example: “lat m::fraktur” → “𝔐”.
 • modifier — модификатор, мо, mo.
 • superscript — верхний индекс, ви, sup.
 • subscript — нижний индекс, ни, sub.
 • italic — курсив, ку, it.
 • italicBold — курсив полужирный, куп, itb.
 • bold — полужирный, п, b.
 • fraktur — фрактур, ф, f.
 • frakturBold — полужирный фрактур, пф, fb.
 • script — рукописный, р, s.
 • scriptBold — полужирный рукописный, пр, sb.
 • doubleStruck — ds.
 • sansSerif — без засечек, бз, ss.
 • sansSerifItalic — курсив без засечек, кубз, ssit.
 • sansSerifItalicBold — курсив полужирный без засечек, купбз, ssitb.
 • sansSerifBold — полужирный без засечек, пбз, ssb.
 • monospace — моноширинный, м, m.
 • smallCapital — капитель, к, sc.
 • small — маленький, мал, sm.
 • combining — комбинируемый, ко, c.
 • uncombined — некомбинируемый, неко, uc.
 • fullwidth — полноширинный, пш, fw.

The search field supports the ability to call some functions and methods, including:
 • “\” or “/Reload” — restart the program.
 • “/Exit” — close the program.
 • “/ChrLib.Print” — generate and open .HTML file with library symbols list.
 • “/MyRecipes.Update” — re-initialize custom recipes.
 • “/Update.Get” or “/Update.Repair” — get update or repair current version.
 • “/KbdBinder.Init” — re-initialize layouts and bindings.

Smelts a sequence (“recipe”) of some symbols into others.
Divided into two usage methods — through an input dialog and through “Composition mode”, activated directly in the input field with the {var:RightAlt}×2 combination.

Examples: “AE” → “Æ”, “A◌̆◌́” → “Ắ”, “Bet” → “Ꞵ”, “ΣΤ” → “Ϛ”, “ІАЖ” → “Ѭ”, “ſƷ” → “ẞ”, “TH” → “Þ”.

Notes on composition mode:
 • “Pause” key — prevents automatic recipe processing.
 • Entering “`” allows output to the composition mode field instead of sending to the active window, which will allow continuing the sequence after processing.
 • Starting input with “A+/А+/Α+” (aаα) or “U+/Ю+/Υ+” (uюυ) — allows entering symbols by their Alt code or Unicode code point (multiple values can be entered by separating them with a space). Alt code ranges 128–255 and 0128–0255 change code pages depending on keyboard language.
 • “Enter” key — confirm input if pause mode or A+/U+ is active.
 • “Insert” key — insert clipboard contents.
 • Starting with “(<Number>) ” the input result will repeat the specified number of times, “(4) Ups” → “ƱƱƱƱ”.
 • Starting with “(~) ” allows entering whole words, “(~) Ra◌̂vna◌̆, S◌̦timat◌̦i” → “Râvnă, Știmați”.
 • “(<Number>~) ” — combination of the two previous points.
 • Using “##” with “(~)” allows escaping unwanted combinations (tho◌́rr, t##ho◌́rr → þórr, thórr).
Combination: {var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} S

Opens a selector with a list of alternative input modes available for activation, representing an additional layer of bindings for various forms of writing, alphabets. Incompatible with {@default:TELEX}-like input mode.
Combination: {var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} A

Opens a selector with a list of glyph variation modes available for activation, representing “rules” that tell the program to send the specified variant of a symbol instead of the symbol itself, if the variant is registered for the symbol.

Facilitates input of target languages by implementing behavior based on TELEX and VNI layouts of Vietnamese language. Incompatible with alternative input modes.

Combinations:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} D — open general selector.
{var:RightAlt} F2 — activate mode for Vietnamese and Jarai languages.
{var:RightAlt}{var:RightShift} F2 — activate mode for Pinyin.

Combinations:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} ↑ and ↓ — create bindings for entering digits in superscript and subscript (¹²³⁴⁵⁶⁷⁸⁹⁰⁻⁼⁽⁾₁₂₃₄₅₆₇₈₉₀₋₌₍₎), while CapsLock activation inverts the index.

Combination:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt}{var:RightShift} ↑ — activates Roman numeral input.
LaTeX
Input in format $><LaTeX-command>$ is automatically replaced with the corresponding code symbol, if registered, for example: $>\bar{\AE}$ → Ǣ.

Input format: \{U+200B}tcalc{<FROM><TO>}
Activates value input for temperature conversion from one scale to another. Examples: \{U+200B}tcalc{cf} → −12 → 10.40 ℉, \{U+200B}tcalc{rera} → 44,05 → 590,78 °R.

The following scales are available: Celsius (C), Fahrenheit (F), Kelvin (K), Delisle (D), Leiden (L), Newton (N), Wedgwood (W), Rankine (RA), Réaumur (RE), Rømer (RO), Dalton (Da).

Format variants are available, selected when specifying the fractional part:
{U+2003}<Integer>.<Fractional> → 999,727.59 ℃
{U+2003}<Integer>,<Fractional> → 999 727,59 ℃
{U+2003}<Integer>.,<Fractional> → 999.727,59 ℃
{U+2003}<Integer>..<Fractional> → 999 727.59 ℃
{U+2003}<Integer>{U+0027}<Fractional> → 999'727.59 ℃
{U+2003}<Integer>{U+0027}{U+0027}<Fractional> → 999'727,59 ℃

Active CapsLock before confirming input disables fractional part rounding.

text_processing.description: This category describes various processors for text selected in the edit field.

description: Combination:

{var:LeftAlt} 2 — encloses selected text in quotes. Sets different quotes depending on keyboard language and presence of quotes in selected text: Меч Танаквиль → Меч «Танаквиль» → «Меч „Танаквиль“», Sword Tanaquil → Sword “Tanaquil” → “Sword ‘Tanaquil’”, Ξίφος Τανακυλλίς → Ξίφος «Τανακυλλίς» → «Ξίφος “Τανακυλλίς”».
